bibl.title: A Flavia Christodote Fragment from Giessen.
bibl.note: Oxyrhynchus, 572 or 573 (?) A.D. The Giessen fragment is concerned with the same affair as P.S.I. I, 76.

bibl.title: Essays and Texts in Honor of J. David Thomas

bibl.idno: P. bibl. univ. Giss. Inv. 63 = P. Thomas 29

bibl.seg: 141.4 P. bibl. univ. Giss. Inv. 63 = P. Thomas 29 145.4 P.S.I. I, 76
HICKEY Todd M. and James G. KEENAN, A Flavia Christodote Fragment from Giessen.
Traianos GAGOS and Roger S. BAGNALL (Edd.), Essays and Texts in Honor of J. David Thomas = American Studies in Papyrology. 42 (Oakville, Connecticut, 2001) pp. 251-254 et pl. 21.
Oxyrhynchus, 572 or 573 (?) A.D. The Giessen fragment is concerned with the same affair as P.S.I. I, 76.
